review_title: WBF is a great place to work
pros:
-flexible hours and work from home 
-amazing benefits, rrsp matching, personal days and lots of paid vacation, professional development 
-passionate teams 
-work is rewarding 
-opportunities for growth
-positive and inclusive culture
cons:
-some departments are understaffed
-lack of planning and tight timelines creates unnecessary stress 
-many, many moving parts
-top-heavy

review_title: Empowering place to work with a positive culture and great work-life balance
pros:
Great leadership who are reflective and thoughtful. 
Considerate policies which support staff wellbeing and development.
Supportive team environment who share wins and losses together.
Very competitive pay for the non-profit sector, with great holidays.
Good relationships with industry partners and community organizations. 
Creative approach and programming that is relevant for the needs of women.
Focus on connections for clients and building them up to reach their full potential.
Flexibility to work from home and/or in office.
Focus on safety provides a solid foundation for teams and clients.
cons: Still building as an organization in many aspects. Lots of improvements are still evolving in the operations side of things.

pros: Teaches you about multiple trades & gives you experience to become an apprenticeship in said trade chosen

So happy that some of the recent leaves have happened because they should have been asked to leave before now.  Wished it didnt take so long.  Organization is great to work for if you want to work and not gossip all day.  Culture is fun and everyone works together and is so passionate.  Look forward to new staff coming to replace.
cons: Some negative staff was pulling others down.  Work set up made it hard to ignore but will be better. Often to much to do but love the work.

pros: Working with women and men who want to empower other women; working with women and men who understand the day-to-day challenges of stressful and busy lifestyles; management encourages self care; all management and coworkers are very approachable; very much team orientated; good benefits and working hours; positive environment
cons: Myself when I get in to my own head instead of focusing on what I can do for others.  Some growing pains.

pros: The work is so rewarding  and the people are really awesome.  like everywhere there is always a couple of grumpy losers.
cons: The pay is poor and there is usually more work and no time.  We are making huge difference but can get held back by negative employees like the finance leader.

pros: I had to be the HARD choice to go elsewhere but I will forever be a fan of WBF.  I was treated with such respect, my ideas were heard and I felt like I belonged. Can't ask for more.
cons: Can't compete with industry private company pay.

pros:
Meaningful work- We literally help people change their lives!
Flexible
Fast Paced
Ability to grow as a person, because everyone wants to be collaborative and supportive
Positive and fun place to work!
cons: Downtown parking can be very challenging
